meanings.definition: The point where two converging lines meet.
meanings.sent1: I placed the book at the corners of the table.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to hide in the corners of the room.
meanings.sent3: The spider spun its web in the corners of the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes darted to the corners of the room, searching for any movement.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was hidden in the dark corners of the cave.

meanings.definition: A place or angle where two or more sides or edges meet.
meanings.sent1: The box was damaged at the corners during shipping.
meanings.sent2: She sat at the corners of the table to have a better view.
meanings.sent3: The children played tag, running around the corners of the playground.
meanings.sent4: The old house had ivy growing around the corners of the windows.
meanings.sent5: The artist focused on capturing the light hitting the corners of the building.

meanings.definition: A position of advantage or control.
meanings.sent1: He strategically placed himself at the corners of the chessboard.
meanings.sent2: The team's captain led them to victory from the corners of the field.
meanings.sent3: She always managed to find herself in the best corners of the room during meetings.
meanings.sent4: The spy observed the meeting from the corners of the room, unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew that the key to solving the case lay in the dark corners of the suspect's past.

meanings.definition: To force (someone) into a difficult or inescapable position.
meanings.sent1: The negotiator tried to corners the suspect into confessing.
meanings.sent2: The cat corners the mouse in the kitchen, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent3: She cleverly corners her opponents in debates with well-researched arguments.
meanings.sent4: The villain corners the hero on the edge of the cliff, laughing triumphantly.
meanings.sent5: The storm corners the ship, leaving the crew with no escape route.
